channel.title: [HELP] Java Promlems [HELP]
channel.description:
When i try to run any client i get this error.
[code=java]'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

item.title: [HELP] Java Promlems [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Opium10 Opium10
item.description:
@Opium10 wrote:

Still the same error.

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] Java Promlems [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @imsokool22 imsokool22
item.description:
@imsokool22 wrote:

path would be

C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk_[b]version[/b]\java.exe
[b][color=red]version[/b]- change to the version you have (ex. jdk_1.6.0_17) and it would be located in [b]C:\Program Files (x86)\Java[/b]

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] Java Promlems [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Opium10 Opium10
item.description:
@Opium10 wrote:

What would my path be, I’m on a windows 7. With a 64-Bit operating System.

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] Java Promlems [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Project_Realm Project Realm
item.description:
@Project_Realm wrote:

You have to set your environment variables so your computer knows what the command “java” means. Use the following page as a reference to complete this process:

http://vlaurie.com/computers2/Articles/environment.htm

Find “Adding or Editing Environment Variables” on that page and follow the steps below. The “Variable Name” should be java and the “Variable Value” should be the file name for the “java.exe” executable in the actual Java installation directory.

Read full topic
